info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 20 at 2:09PM PST until February 22 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 1500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches at 1500 foot elevations and 3 to 6 inches from elevations near 2000 feet upward. * WHERE...Central Douglas County including the towns of Azalea, Glendale, Tiller, and portions of Highway 42 near Camas Valley, Interstate 5 south of Canyonville, and portions of the Tiller- Trail Highway. Jackson County including Highway 97 from Shady Cove to Union Creek, the Applegate Valley area from Jacksonville to near Applegate and Provolt, Highway 140 east of White City, higher portions of Interstate 5 from Grants Pass to Blackwell Hill, and all roads from south and east Medford southeast to the Talent and Ashland areas. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult due to slick, snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions are likely to impact holiday travel tonight through Monday as well as the Tuesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels are expected to fall to below 2000 foot elevations this evening and to near 1500 feet Monday morning with light accumulation possible. Snow level is then likely to briefly rise above 2000 feet in Jackson County Monday afternoon and evening as snowfall rates increase. Snow levels are then likely to fall to valley floors Monday night into Tuesday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties. &&
